info.title: MOOST Public API
info.description: Moost Recommender Platform Open-API specification for public API's

401.description: Unauthorized. Client id or secret is invalid.

500.description: Server error. Failed to obtain a valid access token.

put.summary: Activate or deactivate a rule for a building

parameters.name: customerBuildingId
parameters.description: Set rule activity of specified building.

put.summary: Attach a set of devices to a building

post.description: Creates a new building. When in EXCLUDE mode and no activeRules are provided it will add all existing rules of the customer to the activeRules of the building.

post.summary: Save an interaction on a delivered push notification

requestBody.description:
Save specified interaction. The interaction has to be of form: `{"actionQualifier": "DISMISS"}`.
Valid actionQualifier values are: "DISMISS", "OPENAPP", "STOPDELIVERY", "OPENWEB"

post.summary: Inserts historical events to the database. I.e. these events are not processed by the rule engine when receiving these events.Event customerId has to be in-line with customerId of the JWT).

200.description: Success. All events have been inserted.

500.description: Internal error. None or only part of the data could be written.

get.summary: Get all distinct tags used on any rules
Get push notifications of a building

parameters.name: deliveryStatus
parameters.description: If specified, then filter for notifications with specified status.

get.summary: Get all active rules of a building

parameters.name: customerBuildingId
parameters.description: Load active rules of specified building.

get.summary: Get core data of all buildings. Similar the other GET /buildings/v1, it returns a full list of buildings, but without anydetailed information (such as devices, settings, profile, etc.), which makes it faster and reduces the payload considerably.

post.summary: Add an event to a building

400.description: Invalid event data, e.g. because specified customerBuildingId is unknown.
